name: Granny Clampett
text:
So glad I found this place! Excellent choices on more than just leather/beads! Beautiful monograming, patches to order!
I know people who come from LA,TX, even Seattle! Folks there are Awesome!

name: Rick Mowdy
text:
These people ROCK!
They're the best.

name: Annie Taylor
text: They must not be open anymore. I have tried to call and have left voice messages with no return calls or maybe they changed the number if anyone knows please let me know.

name: Michele bolton
text: We love this place ,they're  friendly ,their prices are very reasonable and affordable

name: Woodhouse
text: The best place and customer service you will ever find not to mention  the quality of the work

name: Carl Cronin
text: Great staff, quality work at a great price!

name: Willis
text: Neat place.  They have a great selection of patches, from public service, military, to bike clubs.

name: Scott Allen
text: Great service !

name: Mary Palmer
text: Nice, neat shop. Very friendly atmosphere. The owners are interested in their work.

name: Jesse Holland
text: Top notch service & excellent craftsmanship as well. Highly recommend them for all leather work! She made me a custom leather holster for my derringer that mounted to my bike for SIGNIFICANTLY less than I expected to pay. Will definitely be back! Nice job guys!

name: Rev. BOSS
text: Theresa and Tommy....good people. Beads and Leather ...a great shop. Weather its a minor alteration or a custom job. These guys have the skills.

name: mark harbison
text: So freaking awesome!    They were able to repair my leather jacket I haven't worn in two years because of my dog.  It looks cooler now than it did before I brought it in.  Very reasonable and the nicest people !

name: Barney Monteleone
text: Great folks. Quality workmanship!!!!!

name: Eric C.
text: The Owner's of this establishment, are well known within the bike community, and their work is Outstanding. I recommend ANYONE that has an old vest/leather riding jacket needing "new life" to it or if you want to get a new one; go to Beads and Leather. 👍👍👍

name: Carmen Wilson
text: Friendly and extremely  knowledgeable  about leather crafting. Great prices, a selection of patches, vests and items you don't know know you even needed until you see them here!

name: Wayne Gray
text: Very nice people and good service.

name: Mark Allsup
text: Great place and excellent service!.. they made a custom patch for me ...very happy and will be back for more!

name: Jo Kincaid
text: The work was amazing it just was a long time to get it done but worth the wait for a handmade to order leather 50 dollar  wallet that will last a lifetime.

name: Juan Porter
text: Great people Great quality work

name: Katheryn Jost
text: Great people. Great work! And fast.

name: Randy Brown
text: They fixed my handle on my guitar case did a wonderful job

name: Michael Thompson
text: The customer service that the staff provided was exceptional. I had several questions to go along with my unique order and the staff helped me customize my selections ro achieve exactly what I was looking for. The attention to detail was astounding! Craftmanship and quality of the leather products that I purchased was second to none. I highly recommend this establishment for anyone seeking a truly professionally made leather product.

name: michael mounsey
text: Best custom jobs ever, great people to be around, and a large selection of leathers to choose from. Love this store....

name: Krista “KK” Mounsey
text: Love stopping in here! They do a great job with patches and have a decent selection of motorcycle helmets & stuff!

name: Michael Howard
text: Friendly  People and really nice work

name: MILO BROWN
text: Been getting leather repaired from these kind folks  for three years now. Most reasonable prices, courteous, timely, and proficient shop I've experienced form coast to coast, border to border. Thanks.

name: Veronica Stewart
text: Very nice folks ! And welling to help you with how too , great selection on leather for your needs !! Plus I'm all for the mom and pop's stores, so y'all go check em out !!!

name: James Keyes
text: My experience with beads and leather is always great. They really pay attention to what I want and always come through

name: Micheal Buckalew
text: Great people to do business with, great service and professional quality craftmanship

name: Hudson Mcgallagher
text: Fast ,work done at a reasonable price

name: Mary Swendson
text: Supper nice very reasonable great place to shop

name: Jake Butler
text: Quick and Excellent Work 👍

name: Christy Owens
text: Wonderful and helpful local business

name: Kevin Whiting
text: Great people great service

name: Ellis Foster
text: Good place to shop

name: Jon Bass
text: Terrible experience. What they told me multiple times would be a couple days, took 2 weeks. Never again.

name: Rosia Gibbs
text: Excellent work

name: Tim Moser
text: Best leather repair in town

name: Delece Bowers
text: great place

name: Bob Akers
text: I have been using Worth Cleaners for several years and continue to be impressed with their quality, service and friendly staff. Usually visit them on a weekly basis to either drop off or pick up. Their email notifications are helpful also. During these unusual times the management and staff are doing everything they can to make sure everything runs as smoothly as possible.

name: JaKierra Lee
text: Awesome fast service

name: m stoup
text: Efficient! Friendly! Priced right!

name: Kimberly Lewis
text:
I went to this location on November 7th to see of they would clean an area rug. The lady that checked me in looked at the rug, consulted with another worker that was there at the time, gave me a ticket, and told me that the rug would be ready around the same time the following week. I called on November 14th to check the status of the rug. I was told "Yes, the rug is ready, but we couldn't clean it." I asked her why did anyone not call me to let me know that it could not be cleaned? Basically all I got was an "I don't know" and some other pathetic excuse. I immediately proceeded to pick up my uncleaned rug that has just been sitting on a table for an entire week.
For the entire life of me, I do not understand why something as simple as a phone call did not happen. As soon as they saw that they could not accommodate, all they had to do was call and say, "We apologize for the inconvenience, but we cannot clean your rug." I would have happily returned to pick up my rug and found another company to clean it. I am pretty sure that someone knew that Friday morning after I dropped off, that they would not be able to clean my rug. But NO, the rug just sat there until I called to check on it.  A simple phone call. Communication, communication, communication. Inconsideration and/or laziness. But regardless, there was absolutely no reason why I was not contacted. This was my first and most definitely my last visit.

name: Tony Drake
text: The folks at Worth Cleaners on Vaughn Road are like family.  They hustle to get me in and out as quickly as possible since I come in on my way to work. They are always pleasant and always happy to see me.  The clothes are always clean and starched just like I like them.  I couldn't ask for better service.

name: Kaleigh Flatt
text: By far the best dry cleaners in Montgomery! I have had items ruined at some of the other dry cleaners in town and charged an arm and a leg by the others. I like that Worth Cleaners posts their prices on their website so I know how much everything's going to cost before I go. Plus their staff is super friendly. I would definitely recommend Worth Cleaners.

name: Cecilia Ike
text: If you do not care about your clothes and want them ruined, you have come to the right place. I recently purchased 2 pretty gowns for my daughters, they wore it to one family occasion before we sent it to worth cleaners. They tore one and used their dryer to shrink the organza fabric overlay of the other one. They returned the clothes without mentioning anything about the damage(very fraudulent people) and when I asked them about it, they stated that they only followed the instructions on the care label, that I needed to go back to the store where I bought it (belk, 21 days ago) and complain to the manufacturer about the wrong care label. Seriously......for even the torn outfit? I don't understand why these scammers are still in business. I left the 2 gowns with them and they are yet to contact me 3 weeks later. There are so many credible laundry services out there, do not make my mistake!!

resp.text: Dizzy, we are very sorry to hear about your experience. We strive to give every customer that walks through the door the best possible cleaning service and we are sorry that you feel that wasn't the case. Please reach out if you would like to discuss this matter any further. Thank you, Worth Cleaners.

name: Kim Lewis
text: Good cleaners. Good customer service.

name: Darrell Moses
text: Ruined my shirt.  I sent it back several times ove4 a 2mos period and still no resolution.  Tried to contact the manager Steve Worth but he would never call me back. Staff kept acknowledging they gave him the message. Before this incident the Vaughn road staff was great.

name: Heather Stage
text: Kindest people, got me in even though I was late! Love them!

name: Just 1 Man
text: They did an excellent job on the band uniform

name: David Asuncion
text: Stains all over a brand new WHITE dress shirt, giant wrinkle in my brand new suit jacket. Steer clear of this place.

name: Andrew Watson
text: Overall pleasant experience. And they fit that stain out of my comforter.

name: Stephen Pierce
text: Great!

name: Adesuwa Tina
text: Friendly management and employees

name: Eric Shugart
text: What a fantastic experience. Very pleasant and repaired a gash that I thought was not repairable. In addition, I had a pair of boots with a rubber edge I didn't wear because of the wear. After about 45 seconds, the entire boot looked brand new. Going forward, they will be doing all of mine and my wife's show polishing and repair. Highly recommend to anyone with realistic expectations around shoe repair and or patch services.

name: Sarah Ramdeen
text: I wish I had thought to take before pictures of my boots. They look amazing now that the repairs are completed. I brought in two pairs of boots and the craftmanship on both are incredible. They look like new.

name: Jessica Cost
text:
THREE MONTHS ago, I took a pair of boots in for stretching. Still haven't gotten them back. I called about 6 weeks ago to check on them and the lady on the phone was very condescending and short. So, by the time I'll be getting them back, it will be too hot to wear them. IF I get them back...who knows at this point?! Save your time, folks. Go somewhere else.

Also, their showroom is disgusting. The whole place reeked of cigarettes and it's just a disheveled mess. Guess my boots will smell like smoke, too. Ugh.

name: Kirk Ward
text: I just don't see what the problem is.  The owner is very professorial, does a quality job and if you ask his opinion on something, be prepared for the answer.............whether you like it or not.  On this visit, her repaired a cut on the side of one of my boots and then did a really good job of cleaning them up without changing the color.  All at a more than fair price.  I will keep going back for as long as he is open.

name: Elli Maye
text: I brought in a pair of brand new shoes that needed a little sewing on a stitch for reinforcement. The repair work was shotty with threads hanging off and the stitch came out while I was still in the parking lot. I went back in, showed the lady, and she offered to try again, but with a trip coming up, there was no time for that. She did give me a full refund. It would've been nice to have the work done right the first time. The stitching was not the worst of it though. The smell of the business is of pure cigarette smoke. I was unable to get the smell out of my shoes and I ended up donating them. I don't understand why this hasn't been mentioned in any of the reviews. Word of caution: If you walk in and there is smoke hanging in the air, your items will smell like that and it won't come out.

name: Cody Mac
text: I've taken some custom leather shoes in multiple times for repairs (heavy wear and tear), and they always do a great job for me, at a reasonable price. If you need any shoe repair, or custom footwear repaired, definitely check them out!

name: Patti Jean
text: Not a place I would recommend. I've been several times and each time the service is poor, they only take cash. Price changes from drop off date. Mediocre  at best.

name: Jerry Barclay
text: Highly recommended!  I needed a pair of dress shoes resoled, and needed them done quickly.  The owner gave me a quick turn-around date, had the shoes ready when promised, did very nice work and charged a very reasonable price.  I won't go anywhere else.

name: hannah vaughn
text: Honestly this guy is a joke and very unprofessional. We went in to get patches sewn onto our vests. He insulted another shops previous work, was disrespectful about our organization, and laughed and said he didn’t want future business if we had any, but he’d “be happy” to do the work we needed (he obviously was not excited about bringing him business). On top of all that, he said it would take a week to get the work done and scolded me for not asking about how long it would take over the phone? He couldn’t quote me a price over the phone so why would I ask about how long it would take if he “has to see the patches in person first”? We went to JT’s shoe repair and they had it done in an hour with exceptional quality and was nice as could be. Don’t waste your time with this guy, go to JT’s.

name: Joseph Gibson
text: Good prices and great service. He is honest and does not try to trick you into buying anything. He gets the job done.

name: Ben Nemec
text: Fantastic service. He'll shine, repair, and even recommend shoe brands based on his extensive experience in the industry.  Would highly recommend.

name: Hegan Belue
text: I had shoes polished and repaired.  Good work and reasonable pricing.  The man at the counter was very nice to do business with.

name: Ben McDaniel
text: They did a great job on a pair of shoes that I thought were ruined. They are super helpful and I would definitely recommend them to anyone!

name: David & Lisa McCord
text: Brady's Shoe Repair is awesome!  Steve is very friendly and does excellent work.  Reasonable prices, quick turn-around time, and shoes that look like new again.

name: Bonnie Harrison
text: We have had our shoes repaired there for many years and he has always done an excellent job. We highly recommend him.

name: Dave Root
text: My mother broke my wife's favorite sandles.  Took them to Brady and he fixed them on the spot! Great service! I'll be going back!

name: soylent green
text: always helpful and offers only the service i need, nothing that i dont need. bradys resoles both my work boots and my dress shoes and the work has always been done beyond my satisfaction. a plus is that the shoes are always returned looking better than when i dropped them off. i always recommend bradys.

name: Farley Church Of Christ
text: BRADY HAS RETIRED.  BUSINESS IS CLOSED.

name: Sharp Shinerz
text: If I could rate a absolute zero then I would . Had my boots for almost 4 months and every time I called he said it would be the next week . He was very rude over the phone and blamed the store that sent them to him for me as to why it was taking so long . Went in and they still was not done after . The boots had not even been touched . He was very rude and disrespectful. He said he told us not to come in till they was done . That the boot store that sent them to him was lying and he had not had them but a little while , but the boot store has receipt for when they mailed it and when he got them . A 2 week job turned into 4 months of nothing. He is a liar , unorganized, rude, disrespectful, and unprofessional. I nor the boot store I used will be using him again .

name: Barbara Lee Norris
text: Excellent repair of three pair of shoes. Highly recommend.

name: Katie Carpenter Stuhr
text: The cobbler I recommend to all my friends...and you too.

name: Lolita Jones
text: Great place to take shoes for repair.

name: Ric Patterson
text: very pleased with his  work.....would recommend to anyone

name: Bill Allen
text: They do a great job on shoes and boots. They do a horrible job of seeing patches to leather jackets/vests.

name: Dana Dunne
text: He insinuated my purse was cheap and that he could not repair it. Very rude.

name: DJ Sam Smite
text: Not done with excellence in mind. One should never have to pay for a repair and then be suggested to have to take it home to complete the repair with a touch up job. Counter productive.

name: Amber Bianchini
text: The repair was poorly done, expensive ($20 for stitching and glue on soles), and new damage was done to my shoes.  When I asked about the new damage, I was treated extremely badly.  I will not be returning.
